work.name: Cisco Systems
work.summary: Backend and DevOps engineer working on cloud-based communication platforms.
highlights: Developed and maintained Java and Spring Boot microservices for Webex Calling
Built and maintained CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Docker, and Git, automating build, test, and deployment workflows
Improved monitoring and observability using Grafana and Kibana to analyze logs, metrics, and events
Participated in incident response and root cause analysis, supporting customer escalations and improving system reliability
Integrated services using REST APIs and Kafka for asynchronous communication
Conducted API testing and data validation using Postman and SQL, verifying correct system behavior and data integrity
Developed and maintained unit, functional, and integration tests using JUnit and Mockito to improve test coverage and reduce production defects
Worked in Agile teams delivering highly available backend services

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Backend engineer working on Ericsson Catalog Manager (ECM).
highlights: Developed, integrated, and tested backend software using JavaScript for ECM to process JSON objects via REST APIs
Executed functional and regression testing using Postman collections
Supported defect tracking and verification using Git and Gerrit workflows

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Backend and test engineer working on Call Session Control Function (CSCF).
highlights: Solid experience with CSCF (Call Session Control Function) configuration
Developed, implemented, integrated, and tested complex CSCF configurations in C++ language
Executed complex call control configurations through system and integration testing, ensuring the stability of core telecommunications infrastructure
Received the Special Achievement Recognition Award for excellent contributions to the CSCF software configurations
Fixed, improved, and tested scripts in Python continuously contributing to performance improvement

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Test engineer working on AXE Project.
highlights: Developed and tested code using PLEX programming language developed by Ericsson
PLEX was designed for programming the control systems of Ericsson's AXE telephone exchanges
Developed and executed test cases using TTCN tool
